/>
IX.iii.1.D.7.g
.
Proceeds From Cashed-in Savings Bonds or Life Insurance Policies
Proceeds from cashed-in savings bonds and cashed-in life insurance policies are considered profit realized from the disposition of personal property and are therefore excluded under
38 CFR 3.262(k)(5)
.
Important
:  Some savings bonds, such as Series HH U.S. Savings Bonds and some State or municipal bonds, pay interest to the holder without requiring the holder to redeem the bond.  If interest is paid without redemption of the bond, the interest is countable income.
Reference
:  For more information on these exclusions, see
VAOPGCPREC 2-2010
.
title: M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section D - Parents’ Dependency and Indemnity Compensation (DIC) Authorization
citation: Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section D
